intro: Siphoneugena cantareirae, commonly known as the Cantareira siphonophyte, is a rare and unique aquatic plant found in specific regions of Brazil. It belongs to the family Siphonophoraceae and is characterized by its delicate, filamentous structure that resembles a floating network of threads. The plant thrives in slow-moving freshwater environments, such as streams and ponds, where it attaches to submerged surfaces. Its morphology includes a central axis with branching filaments that support small, translucent reproductive structures. Due to its limited distribution and fragile habitat requirements, Siphoneugena cantareirae is considered a species of conservation concern.
